translated: Jātaka🔽The Group of Three Collections🔽The Chapter on Thoughts

original: “Ajjāpi me taṁ manasi,🔽yaṁ maṁ tvaṁ tilamuṭṭhiyā;
analyzed: ajja api me tam manasi  yam mama tvam tila muṭṭhiyā
translated: “I still remember that,🔽when you grabbed me by the arm with a handful of sesame seeds,
and hit me with a stick,
aren’t you pleased with your life?
Why have you come to the brahmin?
When you grabbed me by the arm
“The noble one who restrains the ignoble with a stick,

analyzed: sa āsanam tam na tam vera
translated: that is his instruction, not his enmity,
so say the wise ones who know.”
The Tila-muṭṭhi Jātaka (The Jātaka of the Handful of Sesame Seeds), the second.
